metadata.name: Chrony Configure Pool and Server
metadata.description:
Chrony is a daemon which implements the Network Time Protocol (NTP). It is designed to synchronize system clocks across a variety of systems and use a source that is highly accurate. More information on chrony can be found at {{{ weblink(link="https://chrony-project.org/") }}}. Chrony can be configured to be a client and/or a server. Add or edit server or pool lines to {{{ chrony_conf_path }}} as appropriate: 
server <remote-server>
Multiple servers may be configured.
metadata.rationale:
If <tt>chrony</tt> is in use on the system proper configuration is vital to ensuring time
synchronization is working properly.
